response:
the eu general data protection regulation (gdpr) is a legal framework that sets rules for how companies and organizations can process the personal data of individuals within the european union. it aims to protect people's fundamental rights in relation to their personal information, including their right to control how it is used. this law applies to any company or organization that processes the personal data of eu citizens, regardless of where they are based. it also gives individuals more control over their own data and requires companies to be transparent about how they use it.
